After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measure of the overall efficiency of the distribution network, based on factors like cost, time, and reliability.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.FORMULA: Average Efficiency Score of the Distribution Network

After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.EXPLANATION: Percentage of deliveries made within the agreed-upon time frame compared to the total number of deliveries, reflecting the effectiveness of the distribution network.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.FORMULA: (Number of On-Time Deliveries / Total Number of Deliveries) * 100

After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.EXPLANATION: Average cost incurred to distribute each unit of product through the network, including transportation, warehousing, and administrative expenses.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.FORMULA: Total Distribution Cost / Total Units Distributed

After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.KPIS: Distribution network coverage area expansion rate.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.EXPLANATION: Rate at which the distribution network’s coverage area is expanded, measured by the growth in geographic or market reach.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.FORMULA: (Current Coverage Area - Previous Coverage Area) / Previous Coverage Area * 100

After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.EXPLANATION: Percentage of the distribution network’s available capacity that is being used, indicating how effectively the network's resources are utilized.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.FORMULA: (Total Utilized Distribution Capacity / Total Available Distribution Capacity) * 100

After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measure of the dependability and consistency of the distribution network’s performance, based on delivery success rates, errors, and service quality.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.FORMULA: Average Reliability Score of the Distribution Network

After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.KPIS: Distribution network carbon footprint reduction rate.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.EXPLANATION: Rate at which carbon emissions from the distribution network are reduced, reflecting efforts to decrease environmental impact.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.FORMULA: (Previous Carbon Footprint - Current Carbon Footprint) / Previous Carbon Footprint * 100

After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.EXPLANATION: Degree to which the distribution network adheres to industry regulations and standards, measured through compliance audits and assessments.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.FORMULA: (Number of Compliant Instances / Total Number of Instances) * 100

After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.EXPLANATION: Number of times inventory is sold and replaced within a specified period, indicating the efficiency of inventory management.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.FORMULA: Cost of Goods Sold / Average Inventory

After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.EXPLANATION: Percentage of inventory records that match the actual physical inventory, reflecting the accuracy of inventory tracking systems.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.FORMULA: (Accurate Inventory Count / Total Inventory Count) * 100

After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.EXPLANATION: Percentage of inventory items that are out of stock compared to the total number of items, indicating the effectiveness of inventory management.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.FORMULA: (Number of Stockouts / Total Number of Items) * 100

After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.EXPLANATION: Average cost of holding one unit of inventory, including storage, insurance, and obsolescence costs.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.FORMULA: Total Inventory Carrying Cost / Total Number of Units

After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measure of the accuracy of inventory aging reports, reflecting how well the system tracks the age of inventory items.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.FORMULA: (Accurate Aging Analysis / Total Aging Analysis) * 100

After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.EXPLANATION: Percentage of inventory items that are no longer useful or saleable, indicating issues with inventory management and forecasting.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.FORMULA: (Obsolete Inventory / Total Inventory) * 100

After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measure of how effectively inventory management costs are controlled and utilized, calculated as the ratio of total inventory costs to managed inventory value.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.FORMULA: Total Inventory Management Cost / Total Inventory Value

After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.EXPLANATION: Degree to which inventory management practices adhere to established policies and procedures, measured through audits and performance evaluations.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.FORMULA: (Number of Compliant Inventory Instances / Total Number of Inventory Instances) * 100

After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.KPIS: Supply chain lead time reduction rate.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.EXPLANATION: Rate at which the time required to complete the supply chain process is reduced, measured as the percentage decrease in lead time over a specified period.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.FORMULA: (Previous Lead Time - Current Lead Time) / Previous Lead Time * 100

After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measure of supplier performance based on the accuracy, timeliness, and completeness of deliveries, calculated through performance evaluations and metrics.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.FORMULA: Average Performance Score of Supplier Deliveries

After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measure of how effectively supply chain partners work together to achieve mutual goals, based on feedback, communication quality, and joint performance metrics.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.FORMULA: Average Collaboration Effectiveness Score within the Supply Chain

After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.EXPLANATION: Effectiveness of strategies and actions taken to identify and manage risks within the supply chain, evaluated through risk assessments and incident analysis.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.FORMULA: (Number of Successfully Mitigated Risks / Total Number of Risks) * 100

After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.KPIS: Supply chain cost reduction initiatives ROI.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.EXPLANATION: Financial return achieved from cost reduction initiatives within the supply chain compared to the costs incurred, calculated as the ratio of benefits to expenses.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.FORMULA: (Net Benefits from Cost Reduction Initiatives / Total Cost of Initiatives) * 100

After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.EXPLANATION: Rate at which transparency in the supply chain is improved, based on metrics such as visibility of processes, information sharing, and reporting.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.FORMULA: (Current Transparency Level - Previous Transparency Level) / Previous Transparency Level * 100

After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.EXPLANATION: Average time taken to recover from supply chain disruptions, reflecting the effectiveness of contingency plans and response strategies.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.FORMULA: Average Time to Recover from Supply Chain Disruptions

After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measure of the environmental and social sustainability of supply chain practices, based on factors like carbon footprint, resource usage, and ethical sourcing.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.FORMULA: Average Sustainability Score of the Supply Chain

After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.EXPLANATION: Average time required to replenish parts from the point of order to delivery, indicating the efficiency of the parts replenishment process.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.FORMULA: Average Time Taken from Order Placement to Parts Replenishment

After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.EXPLANATION: Percentage of time that parts are available for use or sale compared to the total demand, reflecting inventory management effectiveness.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.FORMULA: (Number of Available Parts / Total Number of Parts) * 100

After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.EXPLANATION: Percentage of parts that become obsolete or unsellable over a specific period, indicating inventory management and forecasting effectiveness.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.FORMULA: (Obsolete Parts / Total Number of Parts) * 100

After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.EXPLANATION: Average cost incurred for processing and fulfilling each parts order, including procurement, logistics, and administrative expenses.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.FORMULA: Total Replenishment Cost / Total Number of Orders

After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measure of how accurately future parts demand is predicted compared to actual demand, calculated through forecast versus actual demand data.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.FORMULA: (Accurate Forecasted Parts / Total Forecasted Parts) * 100

After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measure of the reduction in variability of parts lead time, indicating improvements in the reliability of the parts supply chain.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.FORMULA: (Previous Lead Time Variance - Current Lead Time Variance) / Previous Lead Time Variance * 100

After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.KPIS: Parts replenishment compliance with service level agreements.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.EXPLANATION: Degree to which parts replenishment processes meet agreed-upon service levels, measured through performance against SLA targets.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.FORMULA: (Number of Compliant Replenishments / Total Number of Replenishments) * 100

After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.EXPLANATION: Rate of improvements made to the efficiency of the parts replenishment process, measured by improvements in cycle time, cost, and accuracy.
After Sales+Spare Parts Logistics.FORMULA: (Previous Replenishment Efficiency - Current Replenishment Efficiency) / Previous Replenishment Efficiency * 100
